Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: தலைப்பட்டார் தீரத் துறந்தார் மயங்கிவலைப்பட்டார் மற்றை யவர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Those who have entirely renounced (all things and all desire) have obtained (absorption into God); all others wander in confusion, entangled in the net of (many) births.

Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, those who have 'completely renounced' ('தீரத் துறந்தார்'). They are shown as luminous beings of pure light, having completely transcended their physical forms and being absorbed into a great, divine, cosmic light, the ultimate state ('தலைப்பட்டார்').
Layered_Composition.Background: On the left, 'all others' ('மற்றையவர்'). They are shown as confused, stumbling figures ('மயங்கி'), hopelessly entangled in a vast, dark, spectral net representing the cycle of rebirths ('வலைப்பட்டார்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A stark contrast between the two possible destinies: total renunciation leads to absorption into the ultimate state, while anything less leads to being trapped and confused in the net of rebirth.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The absorption into the cosmic light versus the entanglement in the dark net is the central visual dichotomy. One is a state of ultimate freedom, the other of ultimate bondage.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Liberation vs. bondage, enlightenment vs. confusion, absolute.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The right side is a realm of pure, brilliant, white-gold light of liberation. The left side is a dark, chaotic, and terrifying scene, with the spectral net glowing with a cold, imprisoning blue light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: An epic, cosmic diptych that shows the two ultimate and opposing fates of the soul.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, hyper-realistic, with advanced ethereal light effects and spectral net effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Extreme high-contrast lighting to represent the two final states.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Cosmic art, with a strong spiritual and mythological theme.
